values: All of the chapters have been posted at the spr dreamwidth community.

Nightmare Dwelling 1.1-1.3 1.1 and 1.2 have been revised with a proper version. 1.3 was added to sate your hunger. Take note that it has yet to be checked for errors or grammar. The complete chapter will be uploaded on Saturday or Sunday!

It's earlier than planned, but I have posted the first two parts of chapter 1 over here. There is a total of four parts. It has yet to be proofread, so please don't mind any weird sounding bits.  

Here follow my comments concerning the chapter and differences from the manga. Don't read if you want no spoilers.

- Hirota Seigi is unexpectedly cute. ^^ He comes from a family of kendo instructors and policemen, read: tough guys. So he's very awkward around girls, but he seems fine with someone like Midori.

- At first I couldn't believe he was rejected in a marriage interview (omiai)... because he's quite handsome in the manga.

- Saki is missing from the manga. A lot of things have been sacrificed for an earlier appearance of SPR/Naru. I wonder whether she will ever appear in the manga?

- Agawa house: 'a little problem' is quite a heavy understatement.

I tried to translate the first chapter of Murder in the Decagon, but unfortunately it equaled to having my brain bleached. I'm still reading it and I suppose I'll get back to translating one day, but not very... soon. In other news, I got my hands on the Akumu no Sumu Ie novels (Ghost Hunt sequel) by Fuyumi Ono. I've read some snippets of the book on another lj, but nobody else seems to have attempted a full translation. I've translated the prologue and it's easy as pie compared to what her husband wrote. I still need to have it checked on accuracy and fix the somewhat garbled English. It should be interesting to compare it to the ongoing manga, because so far there are certainly quite a few differences. Namely, the exclusion of one character, Nakai Saki. Some other things have been left out too in favour of SPR's appearance. Also, I'm not sure what to watch from the fall anime line up, though I'm pretty sure Psycho-Pass is in the list. I mean, look at the trailer. Female newbie cop, handsome young men in their late twenties, badass old guy and spiffy guns. Yesss. If the characters can work out a good group chemistry it would be perfect. If I can't get any UDDUP, I'll take this. Story: In the world of Psycho-Pass, there exists a measurement device called the Psycho-Pass, that allows emotions, desires within humans to be recorded and managed by the authorities in order to determine and control the parameter of crime rates, which allow the authorities to have better judgement on crimes and bring criminals to justice. Since the existence of Psycho-Pass, a group of officers has been established by the Public Bureau Criminal Investigation Department Ministry of Welfare, in order to perform their police duties to maintain the peace of society. Ah, why is 11th of October so far away~? :(

The following is an e-mail from the past, composed 6 years and 6 months ago, on November 12, 2005. It is being delivered from the past through FutureMe.org Congratulations to myself!! If all goes well I've become 25 years old today. I will have lived a quarter of a century! Maybe you're surprised to see this in your inbox, or maybe you've not gotten this because you've changed your email. .......... (the rest is in Dutch and I'm too lazy to translate) Oh man I was 18 back then? I think it was a half year after I dropped out of HS. I didn't remember doing this, so this came as a nice surprise. Some hopes and aspirations in the mail were not fulfilled or only half of it, but I still think I've come far compared to what I thought I would be. I guess I should write to my 30 or 35 year old self now....

Ack, that episode was so damn cute! I've been replaying the last couple of minutes, because it was just too adorable and so (unintentionally) romantic. XD ...and DAT music! With that Jin pretty much cemented himself as one of my most favorite characters. I also love how the very unexpected pairing has two 'seemingly unimportant side-characters' (I can't even remember them being in the first episode), who turn out to be pretty important. I think I can sort of relate to both characters very well and their relationship. Just hope they'll get a good ending, but I'm not counting on that... :( They're too cute for a tragedy...! For some reason I forgot to promote , so if you're watching this series, please join!

Episode 3-5: *Jin is okay/blah* Episode 6: *slowly warming up to him but not really convinced* Episode 7: *OMG Jin U MY FAV!!1 obnoxious hearts and caps* Episode 8: *Jin's mech explodes* AGHRJurh;;fjk NOOOEEES He's probably isn't dead, but still! One week long wait! He better pull off a Shrade!

I haven't done one of these in a while, a rec post! Lately I've been reading some webtoons and I particularly enjoy this one. It's a supernatural/horror/mystery series. Think of it as a Ghost Hunt/Natsume Yuujinchou/Yakumo mash-up with a Korean setting. There's no snarky genius character, but SID has supernatural powers, ghosts, and the chemistry between the characters is very comparable to that of Ghost Hunt. Three of the four main characters are in their late twenties and there is one teenager, which is refreshing for this kind of premise. The main characters are from very different backgrounds. It ranges from a prematurely gray ghost-seeing detective, an sword-wielding redhead foreigner, a shaman kid with parental issues and a mysterious profiler. Of course that doesn't mesh, and that's where most of the fun comes from. :D   Si Mun .................*v* Okay, he actually looks more like on the right image in the webtoon, because I've picked these images from the author's weblog. Anyway the main character is sort of an adult Natsume who can suddenly see youkai ghosts due to inheritance from his famous grandmother. He was able to see ghosts as a young boy, but his grandmother hated her life as a shaman and made her grandson forget about the ghosts and suppressed his ability to see them. Many years later Si Mun ends up as a fairly ordinary police detective known for his premature gray hair. The story begins when his grandmother's influence diminishes and he starts to see ghosts in broad daylight. He is also Pikachu.   Tenka On that day Si Mun bumps into a strange and questionable foreign individual whose Korean is terrible and they constantly bicker. He's crazy and just hilarious. xD Si Mun manages to solve the first supernatural case with the help of Tenka.   Baram Right after the first case the duo comes across this kid who is several times more mature than the guy above. He claims to be a shaman like his dad. At first he thinks that the two 'old geezers' are unqualified to meddle with the supernatural.   Sophia Not soon after a foreign 'profiler' arrives to the police department, and Si Mun thinks she's similar to his grandmother. To solve a serial murder case she's taken in to create a secret task force, and Sophia wants him to join her. She's so friendly it's almost unsettling. o_O; but I really like her! Originally it is a weekly all-color webcomic on the Korean site Naver and it's now up to 80-something chapters. However, there are only 34 translated chapters out, which can be read on Webtoon live and Rawcrossing. Just make sure to scroll down and read from left to right when reading.

Let's not try to make this too awkward. T-T I'm just very bored and I suppose updating this journal would make it less boring! My twitter is barely updated so it means more time for longer messages. I'm back and other than hibernation tendencies, life does not seem to be kicking me. In the meanwhile I have moved to a place cheaper and closer to the faculty. It's a shabby place, but good enough. Currently watching Another, Natsume, Thermae Romae and Aquarion EVOL. Recently finished Un-Go, some j-dramas (BOSS, Ryusei no kizuna, Yasashii Jikan, etc) and Sherlock. Otherwise not much else. I intend to marathon Gankutsuou (and Mushishi) whenever I'm finished with re-watching Noein. Anyway, who's still reading this? I'm honestly curious how many people who have friended me are still around. o_O I do not blame you if you don't remember who I am... Something tells me I need to do a friending meme. Also, happy new year!

Just letting you know I'm still alive, and turning twenty-four. :D  

and thanks for the V-gift,!

This post is an everything goes for introductions, friend adds, complaints and whatever you want to tell me. Messages about the communities I run are also included.

On friending this journal.
I don't post much, certainly not every day. I have public, friends-only as well as filtered entries. I don't mind getting friended, unless it's a spambot. My English is not at a native level, so in hurried/tl;dr posts I may be less coherent or aware any strange grammar.

On friending you back.
I rarely seek out people to add, so you'll actually have to knock on my door and bother me about this. Should I already know you from earlier conversations and/or if you introduce yourself here, I probably will add you right away.

[the post contains several non-spoilery manga pages and some illustrations :o I tried hard not to sound fangirly aga;faf]

The manga which is commonly mistaken for a shoujo manga due to its title, basically contains most of my guilty pleasures including swordsmen, detectives, tech stuff, geeks, kickass (motherly) ladies, impending war, great art, etc. I like it a lot.

In the middle of this is Haruka Touyama, a 12 year old girl, and the main character; she's a precog for about 90%, she can see many possible outcomes (relating to herself and people important to her). Someone finds out about her ability, the result is that she gets kidnapped by yakuza, who want to use her to win lotteries and gambling. Before this happens Haruka uses her ability to escape and find the best person to help her out of this mess: a blind man. "..... That's a very grown up thing to say." Despite the ridiculous condition, a lot of ass kicking happens, courtesy of this Mamoru Hijikata who utilises a sword which can cut through anything. He's GAR, ruthless, intelligent and therefore the manga's major selling point... attracting fanboys and fangirls like a magnet (..including myself orz). As for why he can see outlines; it's all in the glasses provided by his partner in crime, Igawa, and their team is called Blade. Their roles are... Made of fail. Igawa's responsible for the transportation and technical things and is one of the most sane ones around. Also watches like a hawk big brother over Haruka. He's my personal favorite. *o* Beside team Blade there is the Wall, from the Elements Network... an international organization which supports these kind of things. The Wall has 26 members, who are phonetically codenamed. Two of them are the leader Alpha and the other Sierra. Sierra plays Haruka's mommy to keep her away from the two lolicons. The detective, who knows a little more about Mamoru's dark background than anyone else. An incredibly moody one too. :D Genda gets involved with the various plunderings and Haruka's case and is obviously making a link to Mamoru. The cast is quite extensive, and most are secondary or side characters, so I singled out the most important ones so far. My impressions: Although UDDUP runs in a seinen magazine targeting young men, it really has a crossover appeal; under the nearly non-existent fandom, even shoujo fans like it a lot. It has mostly to do with Mamoru being incredibly hot/intelligent/GAR/tsundere and Haruka being there to relate to. Also for the interesting reveal in a certain chapter. With the exception of Haruka, the whole cast is adult, which gives an established feel... with lots of room to explore the various backgroundstories. At the same time it will be interesting to see Haruka's development as she grows up surrounded by a bunch of emotionally messed up people, but are in fact new family to her. They're all likeable, I can't think of any annoying characters.

A not so ordinary relationship...

The story is unfolding nicely in my opinion... it's all action in the beginning, but from what I've seen so far it does take time to flesh out the characters, relationships and the plot. The art is insanely good - it's great in the beginning already, but it gets even more beautiful, but doesn't overbeautify. It doesn't shy away from getting gory or ugly either. The body proportions actually look good. Everything looks like it could have existed in real life. It's not amateurish, that's fore sure. Very attractive art. More eyecandy: In short: This is a manga well worth looking into, the concept of a blind swordsman isn't exactly the most original thing ever (Zatoichi, ahem), but the story was well enough to try following it raw. The art is great and very detailed. In other words it's begging for an anime adaption, although I think it's a little early for one... Read at OneManga OR if you prefer it the other way, download the scanlated volumes here: Scanlations Volume 1 Volume 2 Volume 3 Volume 4 Volume 5 Chapter 33 Chapter 34 Chapter 35 Chapter 36 Chapter 37 more links at mangahelpers.com! It's a fast read, so at least try the first two volumes, which equals 16 chapters. :D (....there is a reason for this... read and you'll understand) If you like, join , the UDDUP comm.
